snippet: After years of watching his Central Valley town grow more and more desperate, a grocery store owner in California decided it was time close down.
abstract: Closing of Westside Grocery in Mendota, Calif, which has been in operation since the 1940s, is yet another sign of the way in which the community has been ravaged by unemployment; although Mendota is in particularly bad shape, the entire Central Valley region of California has been hit hard by the recession and sluggish recovery.
lead_paragraph: After years of watching his Central Valley town grow more and more desperate, a grocery store owner in California decided it was time close down.

headline.seo: In Struggling Mendota, Calif., Another Loss
headline.main: As Grocery Dies Off, Down-and-Out Town Lives On, if Barely
headline.print_headline: As Grocery Dies Off, Down-and-Out Town Lives On, if Barely
